details.access_and_opening_times:
About us

Visit our profile page for more about the work we do.

Opening hours

Due to security considerations, public access is by appointment only.

Telephone: 9am to 4pm Monday to Friday (excluding public holidays)

Emergency consular assistance following the death, hospitalisation, arrest, or other serious incident involving a British national is available 24 hours by calling +1 202 588 6500

Visa enquiries

  Service not offered at this location.

Check if you need a visa or send an enquiry to UK Visas and Immigration.

Passports

  Service not offered at this location.

Find out how to apply for a British passport or send an enquiry to Her Majesty’s Passport Office.

Services available by appointment in Washington

Make an appointment on-line for the following services, or contact us by telephone for further help.

  Make an appointment for an Emergency Travel Document

  Make an appointment for a notarial or documentary service

Disabled Access

Our offices are fully equipped with facilities for disabled visitors. If you need special assistance, please contact us before you arrange an appointment.

Press enquiries

Our press team answers media enquiries about the work of the UK government and the British Embassy in Washington. To contact the press team, please email us.

Department for International Trade (DIT)

DIT helps UK-based companies succeed in the global economy. We also help overseas companies bring their high-quality investment to the UK’s dynamic economy, acknowledged as Europe’s best place from which to succeed in global business.

Public holidays in 2017

On the following public holidays, our office will be closed for normal business. Emergency consular assistance for British nationals is available by telephone.

Date Holiday
2 January New Year’s Day substitute
16 January Martin Luther King Day
20 February Presidents Day
14 April Good Friday
17 April Easter Monday
29 May Memorial Day
4 July Independence Day
4 September Labor Day
9 October Columbus Day
10 November Veterans Day substitute
23 November Thanksgiving Day
24 November Privilege Holiday
25 December Christmas Day
26 December Boxing Day

Embassy Tours

Due to the functional nature of the embassy we are unable to provide tours of our facilities.

details.description: The British Council's US team works to energize the transatlantic relationship through the arts, education, society and English.
details.access_and_opening_times:
Working with partners in the UK, the British Council helps to share British expertise and talent with over 100 countries worldwide. Learn more about the work of the British Council in the USA on their website

Please note that the British Council is not a British consulate. They are unable to answer enquiries about passports, visas or consular issues.

details.access_and_opening_times:
Telephone: 9.00am to 4.00pm Monday to Friday (except Public Holidays), Emergency Consular Service for British nationals available out of hours.
Public access: By appointment only

Notarial services

We provide limited notarial services by appointment.

Press enquiries

For press enquiries, please email britishembassyenquiries@gmail.com. The press team is not authorised to answer any visa or passport related enquiries.

Visa enquiries

Visa enquiries are handled by the UK Border Agency. If you cannot find the answers you are looking for on the UK Border Agency website, please contact Worldbridge, the official customer service portal for the UK Border Agency.

Passports and emergency travel documents

How to renew or replace your British passport when outside of the UK and information on getting replacement travel documents if your passport is lost or stolen.

Disabled Access

Our offices are fully equipped with facilities for disabled visitors. If you need special assistance, please contact us before you arrange an appointment.

details.access_and_opening_times:
About us

Visit our profile page for more about the work we do.

Opening hours

Due to security considerations, public access is by appointment only.

Telephone: 9.00am to 4.00pm Monday to Friday (excluding public holidays)

Emergency consular assistance following the death, hospitalisation, arrest, or other serious incident involving a British national is available 24 hours by calling +1 202 588 6500

Visa enquiries

  Service not offered at this location.

Passports

  Service not offered at this location.

  Make an appointment for an Emergency Travel Document

  Make an appointment for a notarial or documentary service

Disabled Access

Our offices are fully equipped with facilities for disabled visitors. If you need special assistance, please contact us before you arrange an appointment.

Press enquiries

Our press team answers media enquiries about the work of the UK government and the British Embassy in Washington. To contact the press team, please email us.

UK Trade and Investment (UKTI)

UKTI helps UK-based companies succeed in the global economy. We also help overseas companies bring their high-quality investment to the UK’s dynamic economy, acknowledged as Europe’s best place from which to succeed in global business.

Public holidays in 2017

On the following public holidays, our office will be closed for normal business. Emergency consular assistance for British nationals is available by telephone.

Date Holiday
2 January New Year’s Day substitute
16 January Martin Luther King Day
20 February Presidents Day
14 April Good Friday
17 April Easter Monday
29 May Memorial Day
4 July Independence Day
4 September Labor Day
9 October Columbus Day
10 November Veterans Day substitute
23 November Thanksgiving Day
24 November Privilege Holiday
25 December Christmas Day
26 December Boxing Day

Visiting Washington, DC

If you are planning to visit Washington DC, the Government of the District of Columbia and the Tourism Authority provide further advice for visitors.

White House Tours

The White House website states that foreign nationals interested in touring the White House should contact their Embassy to arrange a tour. However, the Embassy has been advised by the US Department of State that, at present, access for foreign nationals to White House tours as part of an Embassy-sponsored public tour group is on hold. We are therefore unable to process any applications at this time.

You may wish to consider tours of the US Capitol Building, where visitors are able to arrive on the day and obtain a timed-entry tour pass. Your passport is required for entry.

To book a Pentagon tour you can now go directly to the Pentagon Tours website and book your own tour. Non-US Nationals will need to submit the British Embassy’s address instead of their home address. Further assistance regarding the online booking process should be directed to the Pentagon Tour Office +1 703 697 1776.

Embassy Tours

Due to the functional nature of the embassy we are unable to provide tours of our facilities.

details.access_and_opening_times:
Telephone: 9.00am to 4.00pm Monday to Friday (except Public Holidays), Emergency Consular Service for British nationals available out of hours.
Public access: By appointment only

Documentary and Notarial Services

A limited range of services are available at this location. Please call +1 713 210 4000 for assistance.

Press enquiries

For press enquiries, please call +1 713 210 4000. The press team is not authorised to answer visa or passport related enquiries.

Visa enquiries

Please send all visa enquiries to UK Visas and Immigration using this form.

Passports

Service not offered at this location. Find out how to apply for, renew or replace a British passport including details on the Passport Information Helpline service.

Emergency Travel Documents

Emergency Travel Documents are available at this location by appointment only. Please call +1 713 210 4000 for assistance.

Disabled Access

Our offices are fully equipped with facilities for disabled visitors. If you need special assistance, please contact us before you arrange an appointment.

About us

Visit our profile page for more about the work we do.

Opening hours

Due to security considerations, public access is by appointment only.

Telephone: 9am to 4pm Monday to Friday (excluding public holidays)

Emergency consular assistance following the death, hospitalisation, arrest, or other serious incident involving a British national is available 24 hours by calling +1 305 400 6400

  Service not offered at this location.

Passports

  Service not offered at this location.

Services available by appointment in Miami

Make an appointment on-line for the following services, or contact us by telephone for further help.

  Make an appointment for an Emergency Travel Document

 

If you are in Orlando, we may be able to offer a remote emergency travel document issuing service with the assistance of our travel industry partners. Please indicate you are requesting service in Orlando in your appointment request.

  Make an appointment for a notarial or documentary service

Disabled Access

Our offices are fully equipped with facilities for disabled visitors. If you need special assistance, please contact us before you arrange an appointment.

Press enquiries

Our press team answers media enquiries about the work of the UK government and the British Consulate General in Miami. To contact the press team, please call +1 305 400 6900

Department for International Trade (DIT)

DIT helps UK-based companies succeed in the global economy. We also help overseas companies bring their high-quality investment to the UK’s dynamic economy, acknowledged as Europe’s best place from which to succeed in global business.
